intro: Capnoides latiflora, commonly known as the broadleaf capnoid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Capnoides latiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
